title: Christian Stratton
text:
About me


My name is Christian Stratton and I am currently an assistant professor of statistics at Middlebury College. My research interests include:

Bayesian computation
Species distribution modeling
Occupancy modeling
Dimension reduction
Modeling of wildlife diseases
Spatial statistics

When not working on projects in R or Julia, I am probably out on the river looking for trout or hiking in the backcountry.





Fishing for arctic grayling in Bozeman, MT.









Education

Doctorate of Philosophy in Statistics, Montana State University, May 2022

Dissertation: Bayesian Hierarchical Latent Variable Models for Ecological Data Types
Co-advisors: Dr. Andrew Hoegh and Dr. Jennifer Green

Master of Science in Statistics, Montana State University, May 2018
Bachelor of Science in Mathematics (focus: Statistics), Montana State University, December 2016



Contact
For potential collaboration or inquiries from students, please contact me at christianstratton@montana.edu. For updates on Bozeman Ecological and Environmental Statistics group events, please visit the group website.
